Med Rio Tinto is the world’s second largest mining company with world-class operations in several countries. Over 80% of group earnings are contributed by RIO’s iron ore operations, although the company also produces coal, bauxite, alumina, aluminium, uranium, copper, gold, diamonds and salt. RIO has considerably less diversification than its major rival, BHP and is therefore particularly sensitive to fluctuations in iron ore price (and currency movements). This sensitivity belies its “blue-chip” status, which is derived from its longevity and size. However,
